[Dealbh]
TIREE FARMHOUSE .
[DA 1]
Dealbh na seacaid — Taigh Iain Mòr a ’ Bhrùnaich , Baile Mhuilinn , 1975
© Ailean Boyd 1986 . Gach còir glèidhte .

[Dealbh]
Taigh Mòr Bhìdidh , Sanndaig , 1976

[Dealbh]
Taigh Eilidh Sheumais , Baile Phuill , 1964 — An t - Ughdair air an làimh chlì

[Dealbh]
Taigh Chailein Anna , An Caolas

Ged nach do rugadh an t - ùghdar san eilean againne , thòisich e air tighinn ann an toiseach còmhla ri phàrantan nuair a bha e na bhalach beag , agus ghabh e ris an àite cho mòr ’ s gu bheil e air a stoidhleadh air a - nis . Bha e an toiseach na oifigear air na bàtaichean mòra a tha a ’ sèoladh gu tìrean cèin — mar a bha iomadach Tirisdeach eile roimhe agus às a dhèidh — ach leig e dheth an dreuchd sin agus chaidh e don Oilthigh a dh ’ ionnsachadh Gàidhlig a theagasg .

… Sàiltean sluagh gun fhios
Cò às a thàinig iad no càit an triall ,
Ach sàsaichte lem beatha reòta thruaigh
’ S len dìobhar ao - domhainn .

Seumas Souness , Morton Boyd , Niall MacArtair , Beitidh NicDhùghaill , Jean Irwin , Tom Smyth , Dòmhnall Moireach , Eòghann MacGhilleasbaig , The Royal Commission on the Ancient and Historical Monuments of Scotland , The Glasgow Herald .

[Dealbh]
Taigh Alasdair Eachainn , Cill Moluag , 1975

Tha ochd taighean deug ann an Tiriodh air a bheil fhathast ceann de thugha . Dhiubh sin , chan eil ann ach a sia far a bheil duine a ’ fuireach fad na bliadhna . Mura bheil iad a ’ tuiteam gu làr , tha an còrr air an gleidheil suas nam bàthaichean , nan saibhlean no nan seadaichean . Agus a bharrachd air an taigh - tugha ann am Baile Mhuilinn far a bheil Dòmhnall Mhurchaidh , tha trì eile dhiubh san aon bhaile nach eil duine idir annta , ach a tha air an gleidheil air dòigh gu h - aibhseach , mar gum biodh mar chuimhneachan air na bliadhnachan a dh ’ fhalbh agus air an fheadhainn a chaidh romhainn . Chaidh a h - aon dhiubh sin a bhuineadh do Dhonnchadh Dhòmhnaill ’ ic Nèill nach maireann — ’ s e bha na bheat ann an Tiriodh uaireigin dhen t - saoghal — a chur air dòigh air a ’ bhòn - uiridh le ceann ùr air fad . Air a ’ cheart dòigh , chaidh ceann ùr de thugha a chur air taigh Alasdair Eachainn ’ ic Nèill ann an Cill Moluag o chionn beagan is trì bliadhna , le taigh - tugha air a thogail as ùr làmh ris , ged nach eil e air a thogail buileach air an fhìor sheann dòigh .

A bharrachd air na th ’ air fhàgail de thaighean - tugha san eilean , tha gu leòir a thogalaichean ann fhathast a bh ’ air an togail air a ’ cheart dòigh ach le cinn dèante le sarking agus felt ,
agus còmhdaichte gu tiugh le tèarr air an taobh a - mach . Bha lòsain - adhair no skylights aca gu h - àrd far an robh rumannan - cadail . ’ S iad sin a thòisich air gabhail fairis air na taighean - tugha ro dheireadh na naoidheamh linn deug , agus dh ’ fhàs iad gu math pailt ann an Tiriodh mun àm sin . Len uinneagan domhainn agus am mullaichean casa , bha coltas car sgueadhar , snasail orra , a dh ’ fhàg Tiriodh air leth bho na h - eileanan eile . Cuideachd , bha dà thaigh ann am Baile Mhuilinn far an robh an tugha còmhdaichte le canabhas a bh ’ air a thèarradh , agus tha taigh MhacAidh ann am Baile Phuill

[Mapa]
Tiriodh
Taigh - tugha
Sathalum , An Caolas , Rubhaig , Sgairinis , Baile Mhuilinn , Còrnaig , Cille Moluag , A ’ Mhòinteach , Sanndaig , Goirtean Dhòmhnaill , An Cruadh Ghoirtean , Baile Mhàrtainn , Baile Phuill , Manal , Haoidhinis

[Dealbh]
Màiri NicIlleMhaoil , nach maireann , Baile Mhuilinn , 1972

’ S e taigh - tugha a their muinntir Thiriodh gu nàdarra an àite taigh - tughaidh , mar a theirear mu thuath . Cha robh am facal taigh dubh riamh ga ùisneachadh ann an Tiriodh na bu mhotha — cha chreid mi nach ann aig na Leòdhasaich a - mhàin a chluinnte a leithid . Agus ’ s e an ceann no ceann an taighe as motha a their na Tirisdich ri mullach an taighe , mar a chluinnear ann an àiteannan eile sa Ghàidhealtachd .

[2 Dhealbh]
Taigh Iain Mòr a ’ Bhrùnaich , Baile Mhuilinn , 1974

[Dealbh]
Taigh ann am Babhst , Eilean Cholla , mu 1935

[Dealbh]
Taigh Nèill Oig , Baile Phuill , 1956 . ’ S ann san taigh seo a rugadh ’ s a thogadh Alasdair Nèill Oig , am bàrd

Air a ’ bheulaibh bha am balla còmhdaichte le aol geal a bh ’ air a dhèanamh le maorach a ’ chladaich , a dh ’ fhàg coltas glan , sgiobalta air an taigh . Ach air a ’ chòrr den bhalla — air na cinn agus air a ’ chùlaibh — cha robh dad idir ann ach a ’ chlach lom . ’ S ann mun cuairt nan uinneagan a - mhàin a bhiodh aol air a ’ chùlaibh , rud a leig barrachd solais a - staigh gu broinn an taighe . Agus bha na similearan daonnan follaiseach le còta geal de dh ’ aol . Chan ann tric a chìte sealladh cho bòidheach ri seann taigh ann an Tiriodh air feasgar brèagha samhraidh agus an toit ag èirigh suas gu rèidh , socrach . Am broinn an taighe , chuirte aol air na ballachan dà uair sa bhliadhna — san t - samhradh agus aig àm na Bliadhn ’ Uire . Mu dheireadh , ’ s e pàipear a bhite a ’ cur air na ballachan glè bhitheanta .

A rèir coltais , ’ s ann gu math annamh a bha taighean ann an Tiriodh far an robh na beothaichean agus na daoine fon aon cheann , mar a gheibhte ann an àiteannan eile sa Ghàidhealtachd . ’ S e bàthach bheag a bha ruith tarsainn air ceann an taighe ( agus ceangailte ris ) am fasan a bh ’ aca ann an Tiriodh . Cha robh a bheag a rùm ann ach airson a dhà no trì a bheothaichean aig a ’ char bu mhotha . Leis an fheadhainn a bha nan croitearan aig an robh pìos math de dh ’ fhearann , bha tuillidh ann , ceangailte nan sreath , far am biodh sabhal , stàball agus taigh - cartach cuideachd . ’ S e taigh air leth mòr a bh ’ aig Dòmhnall Cùbair ( bràthair do Bhàrd Thighearna Cholla ) ann am Baile Phuill , aig an robh croit mhath . Air cùlaibh an taighe bha iodhlann ann cuideachd , le gàrradh ìseal a ’ dol mun cuairt . Corr uair leis na coitearan — sin an fheadhainn aig nach robh fearann idir — bha sreath ann de thaighean - còmhnaidh a bh ’ air an togail an ceann a chèile mar a bh ’ aca sa Bhail ’ Ur ann am Baile Phuill agus ann an Sanndaig gus o chionna ghoirid .

[Dealbh]
Taigh Nèill Oig , Baile Phuill , 1952

[Dealbh]
Am Bail ’ Ur , Baile Phuill , mu 1948 . Chaidh na taighean ud a thogail mu 1848

Air cùl an taighe , ’ s e an dà uinneig a bh ’ ann mar bu bhitheanta — tè sa chlòsaid agus tè eile sa chidsin . Corr uair bhiodh na trì dhiubh ann , le tè san t - seòmbar cuideachd . Air a ’ bheulaibh ’ s e an dà uinneig a bhiodh

[Dealbh]
Alasdair Eachainn ’ ic Neill , Cill Moluag , 1981

[Dealbh]
Taigh - croite , Tiriodh
Iodhlann , Sabhal , Bàthach , Ceann an Tinidh , Clòsaid , Lobaidh , Seòmbar

[Dealbh]
Taigh Peigi Dhòmhnaill Mhòir , A ’ Mhòinteach , 1976

[Dealbh]
Taigh Iain Chaluim , Cill Moluag , 1985

The walls of the huts in Tiree are double , and the space between them is filled with earth and sand to make them stronger , to bear the western blast , which sometimes makes dreadful havoc . Most commonly every hut has two doors [ ’ s ann mar seo a tha taigh Dhonnchaidh Dhòmhnaill ’ ic Nèill ann am Baile Mhuilinn] , that when the wind blows hard , the one to windward may be shut , and that to leeward opened . It is not always these poor folks have wooden doors , they then stop the gaps in their huts with thick bundles of heath or straw , tied tightly together .

’ S e ceannagan a theirte ris na bundles a bha seo . Bha e air a ràdh cuideachd gun robh na taighean sin , air an robhtar a ’ bruidhinn , gun similearan . Agus anns an leabhar Am Measg nam Bodach , a thàinig am follais ann an 1938 , chì sinn gun robh cuimhne aig Eàirdsidh MacIlleathain , an tuairnear ann an Còrnaig a bha san àm ud a ’ teannadh ri ceithir fichead ’ s a deich , air

ceann - an - teine … Bha uinneag … ach cha robh gloinne no craiceann innte : ach bha còmhla bheag fhiodha oirre le èill leis an gabhadh i dùnadh is fosgladh a rèir na h - àirde on sèideadh a ’ ghaoth . Bha coirean eile an taobh an iar , agus ceannag chonnlaich làmh ris , gus a chur ann no às a fhreagairt don t - sèideadh . Bha an teine ann am meadhan an ùrlair , ròpa bhon spàrr os a chionn le slabhraidh agus cromag oirre air a ’ cheann ìochdrach air an crochte poit no greideal mar a bha feum orra , agus toll gu h - àrd a leigeadh a - mach na toite .

[Dealbh]
Taigh Mòr Bhìdidh , Sanndaig , 1976

Tha e coltach gun d ’ fhalbh an teinidh fosgailte ann an Tiriodh nuair a thòisich Tirisdeach no dhà air gual a thoirt dhachaigh à Inbhir Air , Irbhinn , Aird Rosain agus Ceann Loch Chille Chiarain , oir cha bhiodh e comasach gun similear a bhith ann mas e gual a bha ga losgadh . Anns an leabhar aice , Outer Isles ,
a chaidh fhoillseachadh ann an 1904 , bha na leanas aig a ’ Bhean - uasal Goodrich Freer ri ràdh mu chor nan Tirisdeach .

The absence of peats should certainly be held , among other causes , to account for what we afterwards came to value as the very superior cleanliness of the inhabitants of Tiree , as compared with any other island of the Hebrides . The burning of coal has necessitated the use of a chimney , and this , in most cases , has led to putting the fireplace at the side instead of in the middle of the room , so that the skin and clothes and belongings of the inhabitants do not become stained with peat smoke as in the other islands . This encourages a degree of house pride which we never saw elsewhere , and the houses , though quaint enough , are often beautifully clean and orderly , both within and without .

[Dealbh]
Am Polar Light air Tràigh Shòiribidh , 1952

Cha robh stuadhan idir air na seann taighean ann an Tiriodh , ach cinn chruinn ris an abair iad hip - ends anns a ’ Bheurla , mar a gheibhte sa chuid bu mhotha de dh ’ àiteannan air an taobh an iar thuath de Ghàidhealtachd na h - Alba .

Anns an dàrna leth den naoidheamh linn deug thogadh caigeann thaighean ann an Tiriodh le cinn de thugha , ach air stoidhl Ghallda — le stuadhan orra . Mar bu bhitheanta , bha na h - oisinnean air na seann taighean cruinn , leis a ’ bhalla - mach ag aomadh a - staigh on ghrunnd a dh ’ ionnsaigh meadhan an taighe . Ach leis na taighean ùra a bha seo , ’ s e ballachan riaghailteach de chlachaireachd a bh ’ ann a bh ’ air an togail air a leithid a dhòigh ’ s gun robh an tobhta air falbh buileach glan . Bha dà thaigh den t - seòrsa seo ann an Sliabh Bhaile Phuill , agus fear eile dlùth orra ris an abrar Manitoba gus an là an - diugh , oir b ’ ann a dh ’ ionnsaigh na dùthcha sin a rinn Clann Dhòmhnaill Ghreusaiche eilthireachd on dearbh thaigh ann an 1878 . Bha taigh ann an Rubhaig a bh ’ air a thogail air a ’ cheart dòigh cuideachd . A rèir aithris , b ’ e taigh Nèill Eachainn a ’ chiad fhear dhiubh sin a bh ’ ann am Baile Phuill , agus chaidh a thogail fo stiùireadh Iain Chaimbeil , no am Bàillidh Mòr mar a theireadh iad ris san eilean . ’ S esan a bha na bhàillidh do Dhiùc Earra - Ghàidheal ann an Tiriodh mun àm a dh ’ fhalbh am buntàta ann an 1846 , agus chuir e pìos mòr de dh ’ fhearann agus de chaitchinn Bhaile Phuill ri Tac Haoidhnis goirid as a dhèidh sin . Thatar ag ràdhainn gur h - ann a dh ’ aona ghnothach airson cìobair Gallda a thogadh taigh Nèill Eachainn , ach cha deach seo a thoirt gu buil , oir b ’ e Iain MacDhùghaill ( no MacLùcais ) , mac don chiad mhinistear Baisteach a bh ’ ann an Tiriodh , a bha gabhail còmhnaidh ann an toiseach . ’ S ann san aon taigh a rinneadh an t - òran Chuir iad an t - Sùil à Pilot . A - mach o chorra thaigh , tha e coltach nach do ghabh na Tirisdich gu togarrach ris an dòigh ùir seo de thogalach , agus lean iad orra a ’ togail thaighean air seann stoidhl an eilein . Agus san linn seo fhèin , gu ruige àm Cogadh a ’ Cheusair , ’ s e taighean le cinn de sarking is felt gun stuadhan idir orra a bu chumanta fhathast am measg croitearan is coitearan an eilein . ’ S ann nuair a thòisich iad air taighean a thogail agus a chur air dòigh le cuideachadh o Bhòrd an Fhearainn anns na Thirties a thàinig an stuadh a dh ’ fhantail ann an Tiriodh .

[Dealbh]

[Dealbh]
A ’ cur nan sguaban — Murchadh Eachainn Iain ag obair air taigh a ’ Bhoraidheir , Baile Mhuilinn , 1985

B ’ e an sìoman - - gualainn an ath cheum , ròpa a bha dol fairis air a ’ cheann aig mullach a ’ hip . Thug an sìoman - gualainn car mun t - sìoman - droma agus bha e air acrachadh le clach air gach thaobh shìos aig an tobhta . ’ S iad na sìomain - taoibh , no na sìomain - tarsainn , a bhite a ’ cur air a - nis , a ’ tòiseachdainn mu throigh gu leth os cionn na tobhtaidh leis a ’ mhàthair - shìoman agus a ’ leantail suas gus an ruigte am mullach . Aig na h - oisinnean bhiodh na sìomain - taoibh a ’ toirt hitch mun t - sìoman - gualainn mun tigeadh iad gun ròpa mun t - similear , far am biodh iad ceangailte gu teann .

[Dealbh]
Taigh a ’ Phoker , Sgairinis , 1915 — Donnchadh Mac - a - Phì air an làimh chlì

[Dealbh]
Am Muileann , Milton , 1899

[Dealbh]
Ròpa man t - similear , Sìoman - gualainn , Sìoman - taoibh , Sìoman - droma , Crios , Slabhraidh no ròpa , Màthair - shìoman , Bun - baca , An t - àrd - doras , Tobhta

seo snaoim - tachdaidh mun t - sìoman - droma , coltach ri sreath de inverted vs ,
mar gum biodh .

Anns an naoidheamh linn deug , ’ s e sìoman - connlaich , a bh ’ air a thoinneamh na dhà dhual , a bha iad ag ùisneachadh — cha chualas riamh iomradh air sìoman - fraoich ann an Tiriodh , oir ’ s e glè bheag de fhraoch a ghabhas faotainn san eilean co - dhiù . Ach ro thoiseach na linne seo , ’ s e sìoman ruadh , a bhatar a ’ faotainn o ròineagan à plaosg a ’ choconut , a bu bhitheanta a bh ’ aig na Tirisdich . Bhuaithe sin , agus o chionn mòran bhliadhnachan , ’ s e lìon - uèir no wire - net a tha iad air a bhith ag ùisneachadh , a rinn an gnothach fada na b ’ fhasa . Ach air a shon sin , theireadh cuid gun robh a ’ uèir titheach a bhith a ’ gearradh an tugha , agus cuideachd gun dèanadh e milleadh air ri teas an t - samhraidh . B ’ ann aig Teon Lachaidh MacAonghais ann an Sathalum a bha an taigh mu dheireadh ann an Tiriodh far an robh an tugha air a ghleidheil sìos leis an t - sìoman ruadh , gus o chionn mu dhusan bliadhna air ais .

[Dealbh]
A ’ faotainn nan clachan air dòigh — Murchadh Eachainn Iain ag obair air taigh a ’ Bhoraidheir , Baile Mhuilinn , 1985

A - raoir ann am chadal
Thàinig aisling san t - suain —
Gun do thill mise dhachaigh
Air ais bho mo chuairt .
Cha b ’ ann lom bha na cabair
Ach seasgair gun fhuachd ;
Bha blàths aig a ’ chagailt
Le mòine bhon chruaich .

Bha ’ n seòladair dhachaigh
Air ais bhon a ’ chuan
Le a leannan fo achlais —
Mar ròs bha a gruaidh ;
Duanag ghaoil air a bhilean
Don lilidh ’ s glain ’ snuadh ,
Bha a pògan gan sireadh ,
’ S iad mar mhil ùr nam bruach .

Thug mi cuaìrt feadh a ’ bhaile —
Bha gach dachaigh mun cuairt
Làn dhaoine gun charraid ,
Ged am maoin bha iad truagh ;
Air lòn Lag an t - Seagail
Bha seachd dachaighean suas —
’ N - diugh tha ’ m buagh ’ llan sa chagailt
Anns na tobhtaichean fuar ’ .

Tha gach càrn anns an àite
Far an d ’ fhàs suas na seòid ,
Gach tobht ’ agus làrach
Ag aithris an sgeòil —
Ag inns ’ mar a bha iad
Ann an làithean an òig ’ ,
Gun smalan ’ s gun chùram ,
Làn sunnd agus spòrs .

[Dealbh]
Aig an tinidh ann an Calltronsaraidh — Calum Iain Bhàin , nach maireann , 1977

Anns an dealachadh , bu mhath leam luaidh a dhèanamh air an alt seo , a nochd anns an Scotsman air 13 . 11 . 48 fon cheann
‘ Suggested Folk - Museum ’ :

The tragedy of the Western Isles is their depopulation . Even Tiree , the most fertile , and a great provider of beef cattle for mainland markets , has suffered . Its kelp - burning abandoned , its fishing extinct , and its peat exhausted , it relies on its pasture and summer visitors for a living . Like some other islands , it enjoyed “ money prosperity ” during the war from the presence of hundreds of airmen . The Keeper of the National Museum of Antiquities suggested this week that Scotland should have a national country life museum , on the lines of the Scandinavian folk museums . Better still , there might be several , exemplifying regional cultures , and there could not be a better place for such an island retreat than in Tiree . The old thick - walled cabins standing with their back to Balephuill Bay , where the surging Atlantic breakers sweep in majestically , are indeed museum pieces . The island has excellent sea and air communications , and its climate is equable — which makes such a project feasible .

[Dealbh]
Eilidh Sheumais Bhàin , Baile Phuill , 1956

[Dealbh]
Taigh Iain Bàn a ’ Chaitchinn , Baile Mhàrtainn , mu 1918

[Dealbh]
COTTAGE IN TIREE

anainn ( b ) — top of inner wall
àrd - doras ( f ) — door lintel
balla - beag ( f ) — heightening of inner wall
balla - mach ( f ) — outer wall
balla - staigh ( f ) — inner wall
bàthach ( b ) — byre
beul an taighe ( f ) — front of the house
bun - baca ( f ) — base of roof where stones are set
cabair ( f ) — branches running from ridge to wall situated immediately below turfs
ceann / ceann an taighe ( f ) — roof
ceannag ( b ) — bundle of straw for blocking glassless window aperture
ceann - an - tinidh ( f ) — kitchen
ceanna - mhaide ( f ) — roof couple
clòsaid ( b ) — small bedroom at rear of house
cranntair ( b ) — wooden pin fastening couples and cross - beam
crios ( f ) — extra horizontal rope woven into roping system at regular intervals
crùisgean - dubh ( f ) — crusie
cùl an taighe ( f ) — rear of the house
glutadh ( f ) — inner wall cavity of sand or earth
làir - chaib ( f ) — turfing spade ( caibe - làir in Skye , Uist , etc . )
lànan ( f ) — see ceanna - mhaide
lobaidh ( f ) — lobby
lobhta ( f ) — loft , ceiling
maidean - oisinn ( f ) — hip rafters
màthair - shìoman ( f ) — rope placed round circumference of base of roof and round which the loops are hitched before stones are put on
muran ( f ) — marram grass
pionachan ( f ) — small wooden pins for securing turfs
poit thrì - chasach ( b ) — three - legged pot , usually with a wooden lid
sabhal ( f ) — barn
seòmbar ( f ) — main bedroom at opposite end of house to kitchen
sgàinteagan ( f ) — dried cow - pats used for kindling fire
sgroth ( b ) — turf or divot
similear ( f ) — chimney
sìoman - connlaich ( f ) — straw rope
sìoman - droma ( f ) — ridge rope
sìoman - gualainn ( f ) — shoulder rope going over ridge of house at the peak of the hip , and round which the horizontal ropes are hitched
sìoman - ruadh ( f ) — coir rope
sìoman - taoibh / sìoman - tarsainn ( f ) — transverse rope
slabhraidh ( b ) — chain with s - shaped hook from which pot was suspended over the fire
snighe ( b ) — water leaking through thatch and turf into house interior
spallachan ( b ) — small wedge - shaped stones
spàrr ( b ) — cross - beam strengthening the couples
stàball ( f ) — stable
taigh - cartach ( f ) — cart - shed
taigh - tugha ( f ) — thatched house
taobhain / tarsainnean ( f ) — purlins
tobhta ( b ) — exposed grass - covered wall - top surrounding perimeter of roof
tugha ( b ) — thatch
ùrlar dubh ( f ) — black clay floor

( b ) = boireann
( f ) = fireann
[Loose Flyer]

Seann Taighean Tirisdeach
Old Tiree Houses

Tiree is one of the most oceanic of all Scotland ’ s islands — one is continually conscious of being in close proximity with the elements . Machaire and Sliabh intertwine with wind , sea and sky to make up the unique environment of Tiriodh Iseal an Eòrna ( Low Tiree of the Barley ) .

Tiree is also a very Gaelic island , and its inhabitants have , through the ages , left a distinctive hallmark upon its face . Amoung others , the Gnè Thirisdeach features prominently in the native poetry of the island ( see Na Bàird Thirisdeach , edited by the late Rev Hector Cameron and also Tiree Bards and their Bàrdachd by the late Eric Cregeen and Donald W . MacKenzie ) and in the island ’ s own native dialect of Scottish Gaelic . It also displays itself most strikingly in the vernacular architecture of the island , distinctively Hebridean in character and scarcely paralleled elsewhere in the Gaelic - speaking area . Lying on the extreme north - west periphery of Argyll , the old thick - walled cottages of Tiree are almost unique , being atypical of that area , and indeed also of many of the Outer Hebrides lying to the north - west .
The need for a description of such “ out - of - the norm ” examples of domestic architecture has for myself been a pressing one for a number of years now . This small book is not a systematic report such as might be found in an architect ’ s folio . It is very much a personal account , as I have been acquainted with the majority of the people mentioned and featured in the book , past and present . Hence the reason for writing the book in Gaelic — a book in the English tongue would neither do justice nor pay tribute to them in a proper manner .

Sadly , as time and progress march on , more and more of the last remaining old Tiree houses fall into disrepair and ruin . Some admirable examples of innovation and improvement have taken place recently on a personal initiative ( notably at taigh a ’ Bhoraidheir in Baile Mhuilinn ) At the end of 1985 Càirdean nan Taighean Tugha ( The Friends of the Thatched Houses ) was formed locally with the support of Argyll and Bute District Council with the aim of maintaining as many as possible of the last remaining thatched houses in Tiree . A start was made in October 1985 when Jim Souness , Murdoch Maclean and Hector Brown thatched taigh an Rìgh in Moss with muran obtained in Coll . It is hoped to keep these houses in order on a functional basis — as dwelling - houses , youth hostels , store - houses , museums etc .
The membership of Càirdean nan Taighean Tugha is now at £2 . 00 per head and it is open to anyone interested , Tirisdeach and non - Tirisdeach alike . For further information please contact :
Ailean Boyd , Baile Phuill ann an Eilean Thiriodh — Am Màrt , 1986
